marketNews.title: President Prabowo meets eight conglomerates at the Presidential Palace
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto held a meeting with eight conglomerates at the Presidential Palace in Jakarta on Thursday, March 6. According to a press release from the Presidential Secretariat, the eight businessmen who met President Prabowo were Anthony Salim, Sugianto Kusuma, Prajogo Pangestu, Boy Thohir, Franky Widjaja, Dato Sri Tahir, James Riady, and Tomy Winata. The meeting discussed a series of strategic government issues, including a free lunch program, infrastructure development, efforts toward food and energy self-sufficiency, strengthening the textile industry and industrialisation, and investment management through the Danantara Investment Management Agency. CNN Indonesia reported that President Prabowo called the conglomerates again on Friday, March 7, adding Anindya Bakrie, Haji Isam, and Chairul Tanjung to the list, to meet with Ray Dalio, who is said to join the Danantara advisory board.

marketNews.title: U.S. President Donald Trump postpones 25% tariff on Canada and Mexico goods under USMCA
marketNews.content: U.S. President Donald Trump announced on Thursday, March 6 that the 25% tariff on imported goods from Canada and Mexico covered by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) will be suspended. The suspension will remain in effect until April 2, 2025, after which Trump is expected to impose retaliatory tariffs on all trading partners that hinder U.S. trade. While the suspension applies to most goods, the United States will continue to levy a 10% tariff on Canadian energy products because those products are not covered by the USMCA negotiated during Trump's first administration. The postponement comes two days after Trump implemented a 25% import tariff on Canada and Mexico.

marketNews.title: Regulation allows mineral exporters to ship raw ore for six months under force majeure
marketNews.content: The government has permitted mineral and metal companies to export raw ore for six months if their smelters are experiencing force majeure conditions, according to a new regulation. The rule change comes amid a request from PT Freeport Indonesia for export relief of copper concentrate, following a smelter fire in October 2024. Energy and Mineral Resources Minister Bahlil Lahadalia said on Friday, March 7 that the ministry has granted permission for PT Freeport Indonesia to export approximately one million tonnes of copper concentrate until June 2025.

marketNews.title: China's coal imports rise 2.1% year-on-year in January-February 2024
marketNews.content: China's customs authority recorded that coal imports grew 2.1% year-on-year during the first two months of 2024, reaching 76.12 million tonnes. Reuters reported that Chinese coal imports could weaken in the future as supply increases, prompting the China Coal Transportation and Distribution Association to call for import restrictions. Previously, the association had forecast that coal imports in 2025 would fall 3.3% year-on-year to 525 million tonnes, down from the all-time high recorded in 2024.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia reports foreign exchange reserves fall to $154.5 billion
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia announced that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves at the end of February 2025 declined to $154.5 billion, compared with $156.1 billion in January 2025. The reserves now cover about 6.6 months of imports or 6.4 months of imports plus external debt service. The decline was driven by government external debt repayments and the central bank's exchange-rate stabilization policy in response to persistent global financial market uncertainty.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia reports household loan NPL ratio rises to 2.17% in January 2025
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia reported that the non-performing loan (NPL) ratio for household credit rose to 2.17% in January 2025, up from 1.9% in January 2024 and 2.02% in December 2024. OJK chief executive Dian Ediana Rae said the ratio remains within a reasonable range. She added that government programs aimed at strengthening consumer purchasing power this year could improve repayment capacity.

marketNews.title: APROBI calls for additional 4 million kiloliters biodiesel production for B50 mandate
marketNews.content: Ernest Gunawan, secretary-general of the Indonesian Biofuel Producers Association (APROBI), said on Thursday, March 6 that Indonesia needs an additional 4 million kiloliters of biodiesel production to meet the mandatory B50 blend target slated for 2026. The B50 implementation is projected to raise biodiesel demand to 19 million kiloliters per year. Indonesia currently has an installed biodiesel production capacity of about 19.6 million kiloliters, but average utilization is only 85% due to maintenance activities.

marketNews.title: Maxim Indonesia says it will not give THR to online motorbike drivers
marketNews.content: Yuan Ifdal Khoir, spokesperson for Maxim Indonesia, said on Friday, March 7 that the company will not provide a religious holiday allowance (THR) to online motorbike (ojol) drivers. The decision was made despite the government's proposal to issue cash THR for ojol drivers. Yuan explained that Maxim's stance considered several factors, including the contractual relationship between ojol drivers and the platform (treated as partners), the company's financial condition, and the inconsistency of the THR proposal with existing regulations.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Ministry of Industry issues 20 TKDN certificates for Apple iPhone 16
marketNews.content: Febri Hendri Antoni Arif, spokesperson for the Ministry of Industry, announced on Friday, March 7 that the ministry has issued 20 domestic component (TKDN) certificates for several Apple products, including the iPhone 16 series. Apple cannot yet sell the certified products because further procedures are required. The certification follows the investment agreement reached with Apple at the end of February 2025.

tickerNews.title: SIDO 2024: Net profit +23% YoY, slightly above expectations
tickerNews.content:
Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul (SIDO) recorded a net profit of 393 billion rupiah in 4Q24, up 8% year-on-year and 132% quarter-on-quarter. This resulted in a full-year 2024 net profit of 1.17 trillion rupiah, a 23% increase year-on-year, slightly above consensus expectations and roughly in line with Stockbit's estimate of 103% of consensus. Management targets a minimum 10% year-on-year net-profit growth for 2024. The solid profit growth was driven by strong revenue growth and higher margins.

Revenue from the core 'Herbal' segment rebounded to 943 billion rupiah in 4Q24, a 6% year-on-year increase and 118% quarter-on-quarter rise, after a 4% year-on-year decline in 3Q24. Total revenue grew 7% year-on-year in 4Q24 and 10% year-on-year for the full year, matching management guidance of at least 10% year-on-year growth. The revenue strength also lifted gross-margin to 62.9% in 4Q24 (vs. 62.3% in 4Q23 and 52.6% in 3Q24).

SIDO reinvested gross profit in advertising and promotion (A&P), with A&P expense rising to 188 billion rupiah in 4Q24, up 17% year-on-year and 113% quarter-on-quarter. The A&P-to-revenue ratio increased from 10.9% in 2023 to 11.7% in 2024. Operating expense (OPEX) rose to 308 billion rupiah in 4Q24, a 26% year-on-year and 85% quarter-on-quarter increase, resulting in a core operating profit of 505 billion rupiah in 4Q24, flat year-on-year but up 133% quarter-on-quarter. Core operating profit for the full year grew 19% year-on-year to 1.47 trillion rupiah, with EBIT up 24% year-on-year.

Key Takeaway: Management targets 10% year-on-year revenue and net-profit growth for 2025, higher than consensus forecasts of 8% growth. An earnings call for the 2024 results will be held on Monday, March 10.

tickerNews.title: $CUAN: Net profit of Petrindo Jaya Kreasi surges +929% YoY, dividend potential
tickerNews.content: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi (CUAN) posted a net profit of 130 million US dollars in 4Q24, compared with 0.9 million USD in 3Q24 and 4 million USD in 4Q23, bringing total 2024 net profit to 161 million USD, a 929% year-on-year increase. The quarterly surge was mainly due to a one-time gain from a discounted purchase of assets worth 152 million USD, originating from the acquisition of PT Multi Tambangjaya Utama and Petrosea (PTRO). Gross profit fell 81% quarter-on-quarter and 11% year-on-year as cost of goods sold rose 28% quarter-on-quarter and 1,951% year-on-year, outpacing revenue growth of 8% quarter-on-quarter and 1,099% year-on-year driven by expansion. Revenue grew 719% year-on-year to 802 million USD, while gross profit rose 217% year-on-year to 118 million USD. CUAN recorded retained earnings of positive 124.1 million USD at year-end 2024 (vs. negative 36.7 million USD in 2023), enabling the company to distribute dividends for fiscal year 2024.

tickerNews.title: $AADI: Adaro Andalan Indonesia likely will not pay dividend for FY2024
tickerNews.content: Adaro Andalan Indonesia (AADI) is unlikely to distribute a dividend for fiscal year 2024, according to discussions with Stockbit. The expectation is based on several considerations: AADI recently IPOed in December 2024, its current cash balance, and a planned 2025 capital expenditure of approximately 250-300 million USD. The final decision on the 2024 dividend will be disclosed at the upcoming shareholders' meeting. Historically, Alamtri Resources Indonesia (ADRO), the entity that previously owned AADI before the spin-off, paid a final dividend in May and an interim dividend in December.

tickerNews.title: $BBNI: Two directors purchase BBNI shares on February 28 2025
tickerNews.content: Two members of the Board of Directors of Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) – Royke Tumilaar and Hussein Paolo Kartadjoemena – each bought BBNI shares on February 28, 2025. Royke purchased 186,200 shares at an average price of 4,030 rupiah per share, while Hussein bought 268,300 shares at an average price of 4,101 rupiah per share. The transactions were valued at approximately 750 million rupiah and 1.1 billion rupiah respectively. After the purchases, Royke's ownership in BBNI rose to 0.01663% and Hussein's to 0.00824%.

tickerNews.title: $BBRI: CEO Sunarso purchases BBRI shares on March 4 2025
tickerNews.content: Sunarso, President Director of Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI), bought 212,800 shares at an average price of 3,630 rupiah per share on March 4, 2025. The transaction value was approximately 772 million rupiah. After the purchase, Sunarso's ownership in BBRI increased from 0.0039% to 0.0040%.

tickerNews.title: $MYOR: Management targets double-digit revenue growth 2025 and outlines capex
tickerNews.content: Management of Mayora Indah (MYOR) said in the 4Q24 earnings call on Thursday, March 6, that the company targets double-digit revenue growth in 2025, with an indicated range of 12-15% year-on-year. MYOR also targets gross-margin in the 23-25% range for 2025 (versus an actual 23% in 2024), assuming coffee and cocoa prices remain stable at current levels through year-end. Advertising and promotion expenses are expected to grow no faster than revenue. Capex for 2025 is projected to be lower than 2024, at around 1 trillion rupiah (versus about 1.8 trillion rupiah in 2024), mainly for replacement activities.

tickerNews.title: $LPPF: Matahari Department Store posts net profit 205 billion IDR in 4Q24
tickerNews.content: Matahari Department Store (LPPF) recorded a net profit of 205 billion rupiah in 4Q24, a 358% year-on-year increase (3Q24 posted a loss of 4 billion rupiah). The result brings 2024 net profit to 828 billion rupiah, a 23% year-on-year rise, exceeding consensus at 123% of estimates. The profit surge was driven by gross-margin expansion to 68% in 4Q24 (vs. 63% in 4Q23 and 65% in 3Q24) and a reduction in opex-to-sales to 47% (vs. 50% in 4Q23 and 60% in 3Q24). The operating-margin for 2024 rose to 20% (vs. 18% in 2023). However, same-store sales (SSSG) weakened to -1.7% year-on-year (vs. -1.6% in the first nine months of 2024). In the earnings call on Friday, March 7, management proposed a final dividend of 300 rupiah per share, implying a dividend yield of approximately 17.4% as of Friday.

tickerNews.title: $ABMM: ABM Investama plans gold mining expansion in 2025
tickerNews.content: Hans Christian Manoe, Director of ABM Investama (ABMM), said on Thursday, March 6 that the company plans to expand into gold mining in 2025 to reduce its reliance on coal-derived EBITDA. According to a feasibility study, gold mining offers better margins than other minerals such as copper or nickel. ABMM is actively seeking potential gold mining assets for acquisition and has identified two brownfield gold mines with relatively small production capacity that are already in the company's pipeline. Funding for the acquisitions will be sourced from approximately 75% bank loans and 25% equity.

tickerNews.title: $BSDE: Bumi Serpong Damai targets 10 trillion IDR marketing sales in 2025
tickerNews.content: Bumi Serpong Damai (BSDE) targets marketing sales of 10 trillion rupiah in 2025, a modest increase of about 3% compared with the 2024 realization of 9.72 trillion rupiah (target for 2024 was 9.5 trillion rupiah). BSDE stated that the acquisition of Suryamas Dutamakmur (SMDM) in 2024 will add roughly 3% to the 2025 target. The company also projects marketing sales from land sales to joint ventures to reach 1.5 trillion rupiah in 2025 (versus 565 billion rupiah in 2024).

tickerNews.title: $TEBE: PT Dua Samudera Perkasa buys ~23.7 million TEBE shares
tickerNews.content: Dana Brata Luhur shareholder PT Dua Samudera Perkasa purchased approximately 23.7 million shares of TEBE at an average price of 500 rupiah per share on March 5, 2025. The transaction value was about 12 billion rupiah. After the purchase, PT Dua Samudera Perkasa's ownership in TEBE increased from 10.65% to 12.5%.

tickerNews.title: $POWR: Cikarang Listrindo completes roadshow and pricing for $350 million USD bond
tickerNews.content: Cikarang Listrindo (POWR) announced that it has completed the roadshow and pricing process for a new bond issuance with a principal amount of 350 million USD and an interest rate of 5.65% per annum. This follows the roadshow held from February 26 to March 4, 2025, for a bond issuance up to 500 million USD on the Singapore Exchange, intended to refinance debt issued in 2016. The new bond's interest rate is 70 basis points higher than the previous bond issued in 2016.
